title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.5: WATER AND SANITATION FACILITIES AVAILABLE FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILIES

description.narrative: Basic water services and sanitation facilities are continuously available for children and their families living in areas at risk of food insecurity., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 1. By 2022, newborns, children under-five, adolescents, and pregnant and lactating women, increasingly utilize quality health, nutrition HIV and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services and families adopt healthy and hygienic behaviours and practices, including during emergencies.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Basic water services and sanitation facilities are continuously available for children and their families living in areas at risk of food insecurity.

description.narrative:
L'UNICEF a poursuivi le renforcement des capacités institutionnelles au profit de la Direction hydraulique rurale, avec une avancée significative dans la mise en place du système de suivi et évaluation sectoriel et la collecte de données. L'UNICEF a aussi soutenu la réactivation de la plateforme de coordination du secteur Eau, assainissement et hygiène (EAH) par le Ministère. L'année 2019 a été aussi marquée par l'établissement d'un nouveau partenariat avec la Mairie de Djibouti qui va dégager de nouvelles opportunités en termes d'interventions EAH en milieu urbain.
| Status:Constrained | As-of Date:14/01/2020

National strategy to eliminate open defecation available with a systemic approach to gender
